raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been complaining of bilateral knee pain for five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray was performed, revealing advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.
translated_text: The patient has been complaining of bilateral knee pain for five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray was performed, revealing advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were administered for approximately one month along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years, with a worsening of symptoms two years ago.
json_data.imaging_results: Plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis
json_data.plan: Continue physiotherapy exercises, reassessment in two weeks

reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain, a chief complaint that has been ongoing for five years and worsened two years ago. The diagnosis of advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis is supported by the plain X-ray findings. ICD-10 code M17.0 is appropriate for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The patient was treated with NSAIDs and muscle relaxants, showing mild improvement. Current treatment includes physiotherapy exercises. The plan is to continue physiotherapy and reassess the patient in two weeks.
